Detailed Description

Barcode Reader management class, derives from ICISMPDevice.

This class handles all the configuration and events of the device's barcode scanner

Method Documentation

+ (id) sharedICBarCodeReader

Returns the unique shared instance of ICBarCodeReader.

This initializer returns an autoreleased object that must be retained to be kept alive. The scanner is not started when initializing an ICBarCodeReader object. This can be done by explicitely calling ICBarCodeReader's powerOn method that is responsible for opening the barcode channel to the connected device. The channel is closed when calling powerOff or when the object is released.
Scanner state, whether it is ready or not, can be determined at any time by examing the value of the isAvailable property. If the scanner is not available, all the other calls to control or configuration commands will fail. Therefore, the application should always check the isAvailable property before sending any command.

Returns
A pointer to the shared instance

Property Documentation

- (id<ICISMPDeviceDelegate, ICBarCodeReaderDelegate>) delegate
readwritenonatomicassign

The delegate object that should implement the ICBarCodeReaderDelegate protocol.

By implementing the protocol, the delegate is notified with ICBarCodeReader's events

- (int) iscpRetryCount
readwritenonatomicassign

Defines the number of barcode frame resent.

  • timeout of ACK frame is 2s
  • default value is DEFAULT_ISCP_RETRY_COUNT (5)
